In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str)
    result = ""
    line_length = 0
    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        
        result *= word
        line_length += length(word)
    end
    
    return result
end
```
This function will iterate over the words in a string and add a new line (`"\n"`) whenever a line becomes too long. By default, it considers lines of maximum 10 characters each. This can be changed by passing `text_width::Int` as an argument to `wrap_string()`.

For example:
```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit"
print(wrap_string(str))
```
This will output the following:
```julia
Lorem ipsum 
dolor sit 
amet, 
consectetur 
adipiscing 
elit
```
